TopicTitle: How hard is it to reach the speed of light in ksp?

Articles.Content:
Here is a youtube video where i attempt to reach the speed of light. At first i thought it may be easy to get near it but i was very wrong.

Final speed (with cheats) 3,742,053 m/s

Link

35 minutes ago, Fenceingmadman said:

 

Final speed (with cheats) 3,742,053 m/s

 

 

That's 1.25% of the speed of light. Still, not a bad result, everything considered. Congrats.

I never attempted this myself, but IIRC that's the ballpark of the best results people achieved in KSP.
Scott manley has several youtube videos where he crosses the speed of light. Using either sepatrons or physicless parts if you have infinite fuel: since those have highest twr.

It's almost impossible to reach speed of light with traditional chemical engine without any cheating

But it's possible via some engines in KSPI
With Kraken you can easily go much, much faster, covering lightyears in minutes

Bill once reached several times that in one of my saves just but climbing off a ladder on the Mun.

But yeah 300 is a lot of millions, no matter how you look at it.
I remember the Sun spaghetti-fying Jeb and him flinging away at a few million meters/ second but I've never gotten anything to light speed.
